pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Private Nuisance Action
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: Statutory authority to bring an action to abate a nuisance and recover damages.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Small Claims Threshold
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: Actions for eviction or for money judgments $10,000 or less belong in Small Claims.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Scope of Rules
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: These rules govern procedure in the United States district courts.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Summons
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: Service of process requirements and methods for federal court.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: General Rules of Pleading
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: A pleading must contain a short and plain statement of the claim.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Defenses and Objections
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: How to present defenses and objections by pleading or motion.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Amended Pleadings
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: Rules for amending pleadings once as a matter of course.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Discovery
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: General provisions governing discovery and duty of disclosure.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Interrogatories
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: Limits and procedures for serving interrogatories on parties.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Production of Documents
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: Requests for production of documents and tangible things.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Requests for Admission
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: Procedures for requesting admissions from other parties.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Summary Judgment
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: Procedures for moving for summary judgment.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Summons Response Time
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: A defendant has 30 days after the service of the summons to file a written response.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Small Claims Limit
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: Small claims jurisdiction limit is $12,500 for individuals.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Summons Response Time
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: Response due in 20 days if served personally in NY, 30 days otherwise.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Small Claims Limit
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: Small claims limit is $3,000 in Town and Village Courts, $5,000 in City Courts.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Summons Response Time
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: Answer due by 10:00 AM on the Monday next following the expiration of 20 days after service.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Small Claims Limit
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: Small claims limit in Justice Courts is $20,000.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Summons Response Time
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: A defendant shall serve an answer within 20 days after service of original process.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Small Claims Limit
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: Small claims limit is $8,000.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Summons Response Time
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: Every pleading subsequent to the complaint shall be filed within 20 days after service.

pro_se_procedural_rules.description: Magisterial District Courts limit is $12,000.

pro_se_procedural_rules.description: Appearance required within 30 days after service.

ex_parte_notice_rules.rule: LASC Local Rule 3.202 - For housing TROs (lockouts), file at Stanley Mosk Courthouse (111 N. Hill St). Notice must be given by 10:00 AM the court day before.
CRC 3.1203 - Notice due by 10:00 AM the court day before the hearing.
Local Rule 9.1 - Notice must be given by 10:00 AM the court day before the hearing.
Local Rule 2.6.3 - Ex parte applications must be filed by 10:00 AM the day before hearing.
Local Rule 370 - Ex parte applications must be filed by 9:00 AM the day before hearing.
CPLR 2214 - Order to Show Cause (OSC) is usually required for ex parte relief.
Part 39 Rules - Ex parte applications heard during morning motion session.
Part 39 Rules - Order to Show Cause required for ex parte relief.
Rule 680 - No TRO shall be granted without notice unless it clearly appears from specific facts that immediate and irreparable injury will result.
Local Rule 3.2 - Ex parte applications heard at morning docket call.
Local Rule 4.1 - TRO applications heard at 8:30 AM docket.
Administrative Order 2020-15 - Ex parte motions heard at 9:00 AM calendar.
Local Rule 3.050 - Ex parte applications require 24 hours notice.
Local Rule 13.4 - Emergency motions heard at 9:30 AM call.
Local Rule 3.202 - Ex parte applications in Family Law heard at 8:30 AM.
Local Rule 208.1 - Emergency ex parte applications heard at 9:00 AM.
Local Rule 6.2 - Ex parte applications require 24 hours notice.
Local Civil Rule 7(b) - Ex parte applications heard at 9:00 AM calendar.
Local Rule 6.3 - Emergency ex parte motions require 24 hours notice.
Local Rule 7-13 - Ex parte applications require written request and supporting memorandum.
Individual Judge Rules - Ex parte applications handled per individual judge's practice.
Local Rule 7.3 - Emergency ex parte applications require motion and supporting affidavit.
